intro: Rathbunia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved rathbunia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
